title: Perfect Price Discrimination and Profit Max

content.question: The graph above shows the demand (<math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math>), marginal revenue (<math alttext="M R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>MR</mi></math>), marginal cost (<math alttext="M C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>MC</mi></math>), and average total cost (<math alttext="A T C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ATC</mi></math>) curves for a monopoly. Based on the information in the graph provided, what is the profit-maximizing quantity for a monopolist that engages in perfect price discrimination?
